{{NCAATeamSeason |Mode = Basketball |Year = 2008â09 |Prev year = 2007â08 |Next year = 2009â10 |Team = Temple Owls |Image = TUOwls logo.png |university = Temple University |Conference = Atlantic 10 Conference |ShortConference = A-10 |CoachRank = |APRank = |Record=22â12 |ConfRecord=11â5 |HeadCoach = [[Fran Dunphy]] |AsstCoach1=[[Dave Duke]] |AsstCoach2=[[Matt Langel]] |AsstCoach3=[[Shawn Trice]] |StadiumArena = [[Liacouras Center]] |Champion=A-10 Tournament Champions |BowlTourney=[[2009 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|NCAA Tournament]] |BowlTourneyResult=First Round }} {{2008â09 Atlantic 10 men's basketball standings}} The '''2008â09 Temple Owls men's basketball team''' represented [[Temple University]] in the [[2008â09 NCAA Division I men's basketball season]]. They were led by head coach [[Fran Dunphy]] and played their home games at the [[Liacouras Center]]. The Owls are members of the [[Atlantic 10 Conference]]. They finished the season 22â12 and 11â5 in A-10 play. They won the [[2009 Atlantic 10 Men's Basketball Tournament]] for the second consecutive year to receive the conference's automatic bid to the [[2009 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament]]. [[Dionte Christmas]] led Temple in three statistics: points per game (19.5), three-pointers completed (107), and total steals (51); he finished second in two more: rebounds per game (5.5) and assists (28).{{cite web|url=http://insider.espn.go.com/ncb/insider/news/story?id=4536484&action=login&appRedirect=http%3a%2f%2finsider.espn.go.com%2fncb%2finsider%2fnews%2fstory%3fid%3d4536484|title=Team Preview: Temple|date=22 October 2009|work=Blue Ribbon Yearbook|publisher=[[ESPN]]|accessdate=December 21, 2009}} In addition, he was an honorable mention All-American and scored 2,000 points over his college basketball career. Also graduating were two other starters: 7â0 center Sergio Olmos, who was selected as an All-A10 Tournament player, and point guard Semaj Inge.{{cite web|url=http://www.owlsports.com/documents/2009/12/8/Pages_24-26,_Preview.pdf|title=2009â10 Temple Men's Basketball Media Guide: Preview|work=[[Temple Owls]]|publisher=[[Temple University]]|accessdate=December 22, 2009}} ==Preseason== On October 28, 2008, the Owls were picked by other Atlantic 10 coaches to finish second, behind [[Xavier Musketeers men's basketball|Xavier]], and received 12 first place votes. [[Dionte Christmas]] was chosen to the Preseason First Team after leading the league in scoring the past two seasons. [[Lavoy Allen]] was named to the Preseason Defensive Team.{{cite web|url=http://www.atlantic10.com/sports/m-baskbl/spec-rel/102808aaa.html|title=Xavier The Choice To Seize 2008â09 A-10 Men's Basketball Title|date=October 28, 2008|work=[[Atlantic 10 Conference]]|accessdate=December 15, 2010}} ==Roster== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 90%" !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|# !style="bacground: #e3e3e3;"|Name !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Height !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Weight (lbs.) !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Position !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Class !colspan="2" style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Hometown !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|High School |- |2 |[http://sports.espn.go.com/ncb/player/profile?playerId=35034 Ryan Brooks] |{{height|ft=6|in=4}} |{{convert|200|lb|kg}} |[[Guard (basketball)|G]] |Jr. |[[Narberth, Pennsylvania]] |[[United States|U.S.]] |[[Lower Merion High School|Lower Merion HS]] |- |4 |[[Juan Fernandez (basketball)|Juan Fernandez]] |{{height|ft=6|in=4}} |{{convert|180|lb|kg}} |[[Guard (basketball)|G]] |Fr. |[[RÃ­o Tercero, CÃ³rdoba]] |[[Argentina]] |[[Dr. Alexis Carrel High School|Dr. Alexis Carrel HS]] |- |10 |[http://sports.espn.go.com/ncb/player/profile?playerId=32038 Luis Guzman] |{{height|ft=6|in=3}} |{{convert|200|lb|kg}} |[[Guard (basketball)|G]] |Jr. |[[New York City, New York]] |[[United States|U.S.]] |[[Paramus Catholic High School|Paramus Catholic HS]] |- |11 |[http://sports.espn.go.com/ncb/player/profile?playerId=41813 T.J. (11â5) |- align="center" bgcolor="#D8FFEB" | 31 | March 12 | [[Saint Joseph's Hawks men's basketball|Saint Joseph's]] | [http://espn.go.com/ncb/recap?gameId=290710218 W 79â65] | Brooks â 19 | Allen â 13 | Inge/Christmas â 4 | [[Boardwalk Hall]], Atlantic City, NJ (4,837) | 20â11 |- align="center" bgcolor="#D8FFEB" | 32 | March 13 | #19 [[Xavier Musketeers men's basketball|Xavier]] | [http://espn.go.com/ncb/recap?gameId=290722752 W 55â53] | Christmas â 20 | Allen â 11 | Christmas â 3 | Boardwalk Hall, Atlantic City, NJ | 21â11 |- align="center" bgcolor="#D8FFEB" | 33 | March 14 | [[Duquesne Dukes men's basketball|Duquesne]] | [http://espn.go.com/ncb/recap?gameId=290730218 W 69â64] | Christmas â 29 | Allen â 14 | Inge â 8 | Boardwalk Hall, Atlantic City, NJ (6,823) | 22â11 |- align="center" bgcolor="#FFE6E6" | 34 | March 20 | [[Arizona State Sun Devils men's basketball|Arizona State]] | [http://espn.go.com/ncb/recap?gameId=294000039 L 66â57] | Christmas â 29 | Allen â 10 | Allen/Inge â 4 | [[AmericanAirlines Arena]], Miami, FL (10,163) | 22â12 |- {{NBA game log end|Temple Owls|schedule=http://espn.go.com/mens-college-basketball/team/schedule/_/id/218/year/2009/temple-owls}} ==Season== ===Preconference season=== [[Dionte Christmas]] scored 35 points to lead Temple past #8 [[2008â09 Tennessee Volunteers men's basketball team|Tennessee]] on December 13 88â72. This was Temple's first win over a top ten team since the [[2006 Atlantic 10 Men's Basketball Tournament]], when the Owls upset #6 [[George Washington Colonials men's basketball|George Washington]]; [[John Chaney (basketball coach)|John Chaney]] was coaching Temple at the time. The Owls started the game with a 8â0 lead and never faltered, with Tennessee only tying the score at 15 and never leading. Christmas started the second half with a three-pointer and scored three consecutive threes on a 17â6 run. For the game, he was 7-for-14 from the perimeter and 12-for-22 from the field. [[Sergio Olmos]]'s 19 points were a career high, and [[Ryan Brooks]] registered a [[double-double]] of 16 points and 12 rebounds.{{cite news|url=http://espn.go.com/ncb/recap?gameId=283480218|title=Christmas' season-high 35 points lead Temple past No. 8 Tennessee|date=December 13, 2008|agency=[[Associated Press]]|work=[[ESPN]]|publisher=ESPN Internet Ventures|accessdate=December 18, 2010}} ===Postseason=== Temple was given a four seed in the [[2009 Atlantic 10 Men's Basketball Tournament]]; they received a [[Bye (sports)|bye]] and faced [[Saint Joseph's Hawks men's basketball|Saint Joseph's]] in the quarterfinals.{{cite news|url=http://www.daytondailynews.com/n/content/oh/story/sports/college/ud/2009/03/11/ddn031109spa10tourneysked.html?cxntlid=inform_sr|title=2009 Atlantic 10 men's basketball tournament|date=March 11, 2009|work=[[Dayton Daily News]]|publisher=Cox Ohio Publishing|accessdate=December 23, 2010}} In the [[2009 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament]], Temple was seeded eleventh in the South Regional, where they faced the sixth-seeded [[Arizona State Sun Devils men's basketball|Arizona State Sun Devils]] in the first round. On March 20, 2009, behind a then career-high 22 points by Sun Devil [[Derek Glasser]], Arizona State eliminated Temple 66â57. The Owls never had a lead, but cut the deficit to 52â49, the closest the game ever got. Temple's offense went without a field goal in the final 5:02. However, their defense held Arizona State star [[James Harden (basketball)|James Harden]] to nine points, less than half his season average, and 1-of-8 shooting. Dionte Christmas played all 40 minutes, shot 5-for-11 from behind the arc and scored 29 points in his final collegiate game.{{cite news|url=http://espn.go.com/ncb/recap?gameId=294000039|title=Harden struggles, but Arizona State still puts away Temple|date=March 20, 2009|agency=[[Associated Press]]|work=[[ESPN]]|publisher=ESPN Internet Ventures|accessdate=December 22, 2010}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{TempleBasketballSeasons}} [[Category:2008â09 Atlantic 10 Conference men's basketball season|Temple]] [[Category:Temple Owls men's basketball seasons]]
